data.description: I have utilized C/C++/C# in various projects during my undergraduate studies, which marked my initial immersion into programming. More recently, I employed these languages to create a small 3D game with a spaceship using Qt. Although I may require some time to regain familiarity, I am confident in my skills.

Java has been extensively employed in numerous school projects. Additionally, I utilized Spring Boot to develop an API and collaborated with classmates on a Java-based software for efficient management of Git projects. Several lessons and smaller projects also revolved around Java.
Currently, I am extensively using React JS for my lumber project and during my internship. I consider myself highly experienced in React JS.
While primarily employed for school projects, I find that the skills I acquired in React can be easily transferred to Angular.
Thanks to my internship and personal projects, I have gained substantial familiarity with Mongo, making it one of the databases I am most comfortable with.
SQL was my starting point, and I have retained proficiency in it, enabling me to perform logical operations with ease.
I utilized Cassandra for a school project and, with some training, I can grasp its syntax and logic.
I employed GraphQL for a school project and, with additional training, I can understand its syntax and logic.
Similar to Mongo, I have extensive experience with Express through my internship and personal projects.

Python is often one of the initial languages for many developers, including myself. I am adept at data manipulation with Python and have utilized it for web development using Django, as well as machine learning with skLearn.
I primarily employ VBA to assist my father in managing his Excel sheets and automate complex tasks or create user forms.
